reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Cooperation In Conservation: Western Hemisphere Migratory Species Initiative

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes This grant will specifically co-finance the following WHMSI activities: A steering committee meeting with participants from up to 8 countries, 4 conventions and 10 NGOs; building support for the global flyways resolution of the CMS COP in Ecuador in November 2014 which contains the work plan for the Western Hemisphere and business partnership for all important actors; 1 day meeting strategy meeting prior to Convention on Migratory Species (CMS) Conference Of Parties (COP) in Ecuador in November 2014; Side event at CMS COP; Quarterly updates to WHMSI Council and partners; Updates to WHMSI web pages and working groups (marine, flyways); Keeping WHMSI.net updates functional and a usable portal in the community; Planning for a full WHMSI Council meeting; Brochure and informative dissemination of materials; Expanding development and sustainability activities; Recruiting targeted WHMSI partners from NGOs, philanthropic sector, civil society. Funding also is provided for travel expenses, administrative support, and outreach..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In response to restrictions imposed by the Ecuadorian government, USAID closed its mission on September 30, 2014. Additionally, International Military Education and Training (IMET) and Foreign Military Financing (FMF) assistance halted and remaining funds were reallocated when the Ecuadorian government terminated bilateral military cooperation and asked the U.S. Embassy to end military cooperation operations by April 30, 2014. The United States will continue to promote the development of sustainable institutions and processes in Ecuador for democracy, human rights, and the rule of law. U.S. assistance will support civil society and freedom of expression in Ecuador.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Resource Management, United States Fish and Wildlife Service, Interior
